It is characterized by its dark, ridged bark and compound leaves composed of multiple small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in cylindrical spikes, which are typical of the Acacia genus. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
